summary: Some victims and family members of victims of 9/11 and other terrorist attacks, as well as other members of the public, want better access to pre-trial hearings of alleged terrorists held at Naval Station Guantanamo Bay, Cuba. The public may view proceedings from 52 seats at the courtroom and at 5 closed-circuit television sites on military bases. Options to increase access include adding closed-circuit television...
title: Military Courts: DOD Should Assess the Tradeoffs Associated With Expanding Public Access to and Information About Terrorism Trials
